Key Match Events: Step into Winter with a Guided Adventure in Oregon
Cleveland extended their winning streak to 11
Neither team led by more than nine points
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 31 points for the Thunder
Jalen Williams had 25 points for the Thunder
Step into Winter with a Guided Adventure in Oregon
Pre-Game Insights: The matchup was only the third in history between teams riding double-digit winning streaks
Last time it happened was on Jan. 26, 1995, when Seattle and Utah entered their game each on 10-game winning streaks
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland showed its balance, depth and that it can get by when Mitchell isn't on
Mobley and Allen combined for 22 rebounds and 13 assists
Darius Garland had 18 points, seven assists and hit a floater to put OKC away
Cleveland beat Oklahoma City to end their 15-game winning streak
Step into Winter with a Guided Adventure in Oregon
Miscellaneous Highlights: The matchup was only the third in history between teams riding double-digit winning streaks
Last time it happened was on Jan. 26, 1995, when Seattle and Utah entered their game each on 10-game winning streaks

Only four teams have posted a better record through 36 games than Cleveland: Golden State (34-2) in 2015-16, Philadelphia (33-3) in 1966-67, the Los Angeles Lakers (33-3) in 1971-72 and Chicago (33-3) in 1995-96
Others: Thunder: Gilgeous-Alexander is the team's undisputed star, but Oklahoma City has some nice pieces. Center Isaiah Hartenstein finished with 18 points, 11 rebounds and eight assists

Cavaliers: Cleveland showed its balance, depth and that it can get by when Mitchell isn't on. Mobley and Allen combined for 22 rebounds and 13 assists. Darius Garland had 18 points, seven assists and hit a floater to put OKC away
Step into Winter with a Guided Adventure in Oregon

With Cleveland up 125-122, Mitchell was called for a loose ball foul with 1:19 left. The Cavs challenged and the call was reversed by replay review. Mobley then hit a 10-footer in the lane to put Cleveland up by five
Key stat: Only four teams have posted a better record through 36 games than Cleveland
